results.title: Drug-Induced Complete Atrioventricular Block in an Elderly Patient: A Case Report Highlighting Digoxin-Beta Blocker Interactions and a Paradoxical State.
results.text_hl: Her medical history included @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, and @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@, with a medication regimen of @CHEMICAL_Digoxin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004077 @@@digoxin@@@ 0.25 mg given daily 5 days out of 7, @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ 50 mg twice daily, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10 mg daily, @CHEMICAL_Furosemide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005665 @@@furosemide@@@ 40 mg daily, and @CHEMICAL_Spironolactone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013148 @@@spironolactone@@@ 50 mg daily.

citations.NLM: Bustea C, Radu AF, Vesa CM, Radu A, Bodog TM, Bodog RF, Maghiar PB, Maghiar AM. Drug-Induced Complete Atrioventricular Block in an Elderly Patient: A Case Report Highlighting Digoxin-Beta Blocker Interactions and a Paradoxical State. Life (Basel). 2025 Jan 31;15(2):. PMID: 40003624
citations.BibTeX: @article{40003624, title={Drug-Induced Complete Atrioventricular Block in an Elderly Patient: A Case Report Highlighting Digoxin-Beta Blocker Interactions and a Paradoxical State.}, author={Bustea C and Radu AF and Vesa CM and Radu A and Bodog TM and Bodog RF and Maghiar PB and Maghiar AM}, journal={Life (Basel)}, volume={15}, number={2}}

results.title: Effects of lisinopril in patients with heart failure and chronic atrial fibrillation.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@ and chronic @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@.

results.title: Pharmacologic Prevention of Incident Atrial Fibrillation: Long-Term Results From the ALLHAT (Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial).
results.text_hl: We sought to determine whether randomization to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ reduces incident @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@AF@@@ or @DISEASE_Atrial_Flutter @DISEASE_MESH:D001282 @@@atrial flutter@@@ (@DISEASE_Atrial_Flutter @DISEASE_MESH:D001282 @@@AFL@@@) compared with @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ in a large clinical trial cohort with extended post-trial surveillance.

citations.NLM: Dewland TA, Soliman EZ, Yamal JM, Davis BR, Alonso A, Albert CM, Simpson LM, Haywood LJ, Marcus GM. Pharmacologic Prevention of Incident Atrial Fibrillation: Long-Term Results From the ALLHAT (Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial). Circ Arrhythm Electrophysiol. 2017 Dec;10(12):. PMID: 29212812

results.title: Effect of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor therapy in mitral regurgitation with normal left ventricular function.
results.text_hl: The study drug was stopped in four @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ after one @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ presented with rapid @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@ and @DISEASE_Angina_Pectoris @DISEASE_MESH:D000787 @@@angina@@@ while three @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were intolerant to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Marcotte F, Honos GN, Walling AD, Beauvais D, Blais MJ, Daoust C, Lisbona A, McCans JL. Effect of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor therapy in mitral regurgitation with normal left ventricular function. Can J Cardiol. 1997 May;13(5):479-85. PMID: 9179087

results.title: Prolonged anticoagulant activity of rivaroxaban in a polymorbid elderly female with non-convulsive epileptic state.
results.text_hl: CASE REPORT: A 88-years-old female (body-mass-index = 19.95) with @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@AF@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@, hospitalized because of @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@ and a non-@DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@convulsive epileptic@@@ state, was treated by @CHEMICAL_Valproic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014635 @@@valproate@@@, mirtazepin, @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Digitoxin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004074 @@@digitoxin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Gliclazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005907 @@@gliclazide@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Stöllberger C, Finsterer J. Prolonged anticoagulant activity of rivaroxaban in a polymorbid elderly female with non-convulsive epileptic state. Heart Lung. 2014 May-Jun;43(3):262-3. PMID: 24794785

results.title: Ask the doctor. I am 75 and have had atrial fibrillation for a while. I take digoxin, lisinopril, Coumadin, and Lipitor. My medications seem to work, but I'm still concerned about the big difference between my systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings. The systolic is usually between 130 and 150 and the diastolic is between 55 and 70. Should I worry about this?
results.text_hl: I am 75 and have had @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@ for a while.

citations.NLM: Ask the doctor. I am 75 and have had atrial fibrillation for a while. I take digoxin, lisinopril, Coumadin, and Lipitor. My medications seem to work, but I'm still concerned about the big difference between my systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings. The systolic is usually between 130 and 150 and the diastolic is between 55 and 70. Should I worry about this? Harv Heart Lett. 2003 Jun;13(10):8. PMID: 12835154

results.title: Therapy Management Using Modified 2-Weeks-On/1-Week-Off Dosing Schedule in Patients With Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Receiving Sunitinib: A Hypothetical, Illustrative Case Scenario
results.text_hl: Brady's medical history includes nonvalvular @<m>DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@, which is treated with @CHEMICAL_apixaban @CHEMICAL_MESH:C522181 @@@apixaban@@@; @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ that is adequately controlled (blood pressure 137/79 mm Hg) with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ at 20 mg/day; @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@; and @DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ that is treated with @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ at 20 mg/day.

citations.NLM: Allman KD, Ryan JC, Clair A, Yenser-Wood S. Therapy Management Using Modified 2-Weeks-On/1-Week-Off Dosing Schedule in Patients With Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Receiving Sunitinib: A Hypothetical, Illustrative Case Scenario J Adv Pract Oncol. 2019 Jul;10(5):483-493. PMID: 33457061
